page.title: 10"CORNED BEEF ISLAND", HULL
page.content: The Preston Road estate built in the 20's was known to older residents as "Corned Beef Island", due to its then isolated position necessitating the stocking up with cheap food(O.S 1928) "In 1927 we were the first tenants of Ganstead Grove.We moved from Northumberland Ave., from a "Sham 4", because my brother had contracted a mild case of T.B & needed"fresh air". It was our first house with a bathroom or garden". {Mrs.E.Campbell(Locking) } In subsequent years the estate became notorious for dereliction & vandalism especially Tunstall Gr.(see Hull Daily Mail 11/5/82 13/10/82 14/10/82 26/10/82).The city council decided to upgrade the whole area at an average cost of Â£8000 to try and improve its "downmarket image".Tunstall Gr. was subsequently converted into flats for the elderly & renamed"Campbell Court"
